title: Four wounded in gang shooting at Portland community center
content:
PORTLAND, Ore. – Four young people were wounded during a shooting between rival gang members during a birthday party at a Southeast Portland community center, police said.
More than two-dozen shots were fired during the Saturday night shootout at the Rosewood Community Center, located at 16126 S.E. Stark St., according to Sgt. Pete Simpson with Portland police.
A 15-year-old girl, a 17-year-old boy, a 19-year-old man and a 20-year-old man were wounded in the shooting. Police expected all four to survive. Their names were not immediately released due to an ongoing investigation.
Detectives with the bureau’s Gang Enforcement Team are investigating the shooting. No arrests have been made.
Anyone with information is asked to call Detective Jeff Pontius at 503-823-2081 or Detective Todd Teats at 503-823-2137.
